page.title: 15Community Attitudes
page.content: There is a{strong sense of community in Denby but unless you are a second or third generation Denby-born, you are still regarded as a{"comer-in"}by the locals. Since the building of the new houses in the village, the old villagers cannot be quite as insular as they were but the old attitude still remains. {Most people}work and shop outside the village as they have cars and travel to the town for their jobs and shops. The old people with no transport still shop at the village shop/PO which serves also as the place to meet and gossip to their friends. The only{work}available in the area is generally on the farms and this quite often is seasonal with{hay-making, {potato picking etc.
